result.markdown:
---
title: "Iniciando teste T"
author: "Yuri"
format: html

execute: 
  freeze: auto
  cache: true
  warning: false
---


## Importar dados


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_787731a98259a728673514ca23e8e5ef'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(readxl)
mg <- read_excel("dados-diversos.xlsx")
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_14f3c50e44791fd2973ceb6d92c4fdd3'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mg |> 
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  geom_jitter(width =0.05)+
  geom_boxplot(fill = NA, 
               outlier.colour = NA)+
  ylim(5, 20)+
  annotate(geom = "text",
           x = 0.7, y = 19,
           label = "t = 8.12; P < 0.001;")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_e9b735c2d40effd57bd027979f637e03'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mg |> 
  
  ggplot(aes(trat, comp))+
  stat_summary(fun.data = "mean_se")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](aula8_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-4_ef3ac0ec8b12caf261897f823b6d9574'}

```{.r .cell-code}
mg2 <- mg |> 
  pivot_wider(1, 
              names_from = trat,
              values_from = comp)
```
:::

::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_10d2af67350b829b9ed018577ce0a377'}

```{.r .cell-code}
t <- t.test(mg2$Mg2, mg2$control)
t
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Welch Two Sample t-test

data:  mg2$Mg2 and mg2$control
t = -8.1549, df = 17.354, p-value = 2.423e-07
alternative hypothesis: true difference in means is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 -6.490393 -3.825607
sample estimates:
mean of x mean of y 
   10.520    15.678 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
library(report)
report(t)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations.

The Welch Two Sample t-test testing the difference between mg2$Mg2 and
mg2$control (mean of x = 10.52, mean of y = 15.68) suggests that the effect is
negative, statistically significant, and large (difference = -5.16, 95% CI
[-6.49, -3.83], t(17.35) = -8.15, p < .001; Cohen's d = -3.65, 95% CI [-5.12,
-2.14])
```
:::
:::


## Usando o pacote infer:


::: {.cell hash='aula8_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_dd8913ab1eef3e967ae569d1c9d2f587'}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(infer)
mg |> 
  t_test(comp ~ trat,
         order = c("control", "Mg2"))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 1 Ã— 7
  statistic  t_df     p_value alternative estimate lower_ci upper_ci
      <dbl> <dbl>       <dbl> <chr>          <dbl>    <dbl>    <dbl>
1      8.15  17.4 0.000000242 two.sided       5.16     3.83     6.49
```
:::
:::


https://www.datanovia.com/en/lessons/t-test-in-r/
